questions.question_text: Which two functionalities are provided by Session Border Controllers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A y E, provee funciones en capa 5 (señal y media), no en capa 3

comments.content: sorry right A and C - answer B refers to "Pstn" borders - while sbc it's about IP networks

discussion.content: correct answers are B and C

choices.A: they span multiple networks and provide edge proxy functions between them
choices.C: they enable premium interactive services across IP network borders by complementing existing edge routers
choices.E: they replace typical edge routers and firewalls in order to provide a unified network border for signaling and media control
choices.D: they provide routing functions for IP, TCP, and SMTP using application parameters.
choices.B: they are session-aware devices that enable control of end-to-end interactive communications across PSTN network borders

comments.content: Wrong IMO. It says that is not routing calls to a SPECIFIC endpoint, so we should assume other endpoints are working. If so, registration-caching is surely enabled in access realm (so D doesn’t apply). E is wrong because policy is for routing traffic access -> backbone (the question says it’s not working backbone -> access), for me is wrong. Correct answer is B IMO, that command shows registration status of a SPECIFIC endpoint, to me is the best fit answer.

discussion.content:
Registration cache is routing from Backbone to Access realm
Local policy is routing from Access to Backbone realm
Correct answer: E

questions.question_text:
The Session Border Controller is not routing calls to a specific SIP endpoint from the backbone realm to the access realm in an Access-Backbone architecture.
How can you troubleshoot this routing issue?

choices.A: by running the notify berpd force command
choices.D: by checking the registration-cache configuration element used for routing from the access realm to the backbone realm
choices.C: by checking the sip-manipulation configuration element used for routing from the backbone realm to the access realm
choices.B: by running the show sipd endpoint-ip <phone number> command
choices.E: by checking the local-policy configuration element used for routing from the access realm to the backbone realm

discussion.content: On the actual test, either B or D is replaced with out-manipulationid

I think the list of answers is incorrect. However, the 3 places you can use HMR is session agent, sip interface and realm. So B, C, D, in this case are correct, but likely the real question has an option for realm.
B and D are the same. Correct answer BCD

questions.question_text: Which three options are valid ways to apply Header Manipulation Rules (HMRs) to your existing configuration?

choices.A: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and configure the in-manipulationid parameter.
choices.E: Navigate to the session-group configuration element and configure the in-manipulationid parameter.
choices.C: Navigate to the sip-interface configuration element and configure the in-manipulationid parameter.
choices.B: Navigate to the session-agent configuration element and configure the in-manipulationid parameter.
choices.D: Navigate to the session-agent configuration element and configure the in-manipulationid parameter.

questions.question_text: In which two ways can you remove support for telnet from a media interface? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and run the delete-hip-ip <IP address> command.
choices.E: Navigate to the phy-interface configuration element and run the remove-telnet-ip <IP address> command.
choices.D: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and run the remove-hip-ip <IP address> command.
choices.C: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and run the remove-telnet-ip <IP address> command.
choices.B: Navigate to the phy-interface configuration element and run the remove-hip-ip <IP address> command.

discussion.content:
delete-hip-ip do not exist
Correct answer: CD
The object need to be selected. Correct answer A

choices.A: Select the element and then issue the show command.
choices.E: Enter the name of the element and then issue the show command.
choices.C: Type show ? and select from the displayed list.

questions.question_text:
You want to view an existing multiple-instance elements configuration.
What step should you perform after you go to the correct branch of the configuration tree?
